I am able to update my 4.1 app to 4.2 but unable to boot from the DW files burned to disk.  It comes up as a bootable option onscreen but never does boot (wheel just spins). I've tried making two disks using different optical drives. Has anyone else been successful making a bootable CD and then actually booting to it?  The ability to boot may require a direct image rather then a (dmg) copy.

Still, for my purposes this solved my problem.  If you read the Mac forums you'll see that Alsoft is the worst software maker when it comes to customer support.  After two weeks of trying to get their update program to work and many emails and faxes many of us have been duly ignored.

I burned a DVD. Did you try a CD?

This DMG is compressed & when uncompressed is 1.25gb, so it won't fit onto any CD !

I used the Macbook's  'Disk Utilty' program to burn this dmg image straight to DVD, once 'disk utility' verifies...then...

Leave the disc in the machine + re boot + immediately hold down the 'C' key before the Apple logo appears & the DVD disc will boot up in its own time !
